rComments: Prof Bradley is an average prof, this class was not particularly hard for me and there wasn't too much homework other than short assignments towards the end of the course. Lectures are pretty boring and he's really monotone, he basically just explains the PDF that he posts in Brightspace.

He was nice and the class was easy but the lectures were pretty boring. He just talks the entire time and its hard to focus i usually ended up going on my phone during it, still got A on all the quizzes and assignments so the lectures felt pretty useless as long as you read the handouts.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: I chose this course for my English requirement but ended up dropping it the week after, because there were WAY to many readings! This prof talks about cool things during lecture, he is really knowledgeable but personally this course was way too tough (impossible for me to complete even)! I love reading, but maybe Ill take another course with him.

Lectures are BORING. Only a couple quizzes in the first half of the semester, but during the second half we had regular quizzes and weekly assignments alongside the final essay. Wish the workload was spread out a bit throughout the term. TA was better/more helpful than the prof. Definitely take the course with someone else if you can.

Honestly very disorganized. His lectures were so heavy, about 3 hours of him talking non-stop about everything (not following his own handouts), without any visual support (no PPT, Word, nothing). Feedback was not very good/no explanation on points that were lost. Responds very slowly to emails, but is really helpful 1 on 1 for assignments
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: I think he is very professional and helpful. His explanations help me better understand writing essays. If you like online courses you should take his class. He records his lectures but it is always better to join live as he mostly answers questions during class. Never seen him make jokes or talk about irrelevant things. Extremely professional.
Professor Bradley did not have any live lectures and would randomly post lecture videos. There were quizzes and assignments every week, and also a lack of communication.

Class was online so heavily lecture based and frequent quizzes. He wasn't necessarily a bad prof but his lectures were kind of boring and redundant. Course load was not heavy, gave you notes on lectures which was helpful. Grading wasn't too tough as his rubric is super clear and assignments are pretty straightforward.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Beware of pop quizzes', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: I'm honestly not sure about this professor. On one hand he is very laid back and the material is super easy, on the other hand he is not a very interesting lecturer and the marks for quizzes and assignments take forever to be returned. All the notes are already typed up and everything is open-book. Kind of a meh class. Oh, and put it to 2x speed.

not much studying (open book & he provided the notes), short videos but just of him sitting there. monotone videos, lots of ummmm... which was boring but pretty easy to get a decent grade. very nice & approachable, nothing really stands out about him or his course but no major complaints. didnt mark too difficult but doesnt give good feedback

One of the worst profs I've ever met. Most profs use virtual conference but he just uploaded his videos, sitting there, and just talking casually without PPT, and his a lot of pause and "umm..." really distract me, soooo boring lecture!! Too many readings for a 6 week summer course, and his boring lecture brings more difficulty to get a good grade

No PPT, just looking at the Prof. Cannot concentrate to what he's talking about at all. Summer term is short and he postponed deadline of 2nd assignment so that feedback is postponed (doesn't come out yet on Jul 28); Then feedback of assignment 3 is also postponed, while he wants us to write assignment 4 (deadline Aug 5) based on this feedback...
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Honestly, just a laid back prof who helps you improve by leaving you to yourself. He provided the information, and we did what we needed to do. I did what was expected and I got an easy A. If I can I will take his classes in the future, apart from his pretty boring lectures, he's a good prof.

Most boring lectures I've ever sat through (no PPTs, just talking to the class), attendance is mandatory because of pop quizzes but if it wasn't I would've skipped. The lectures barely carry over to the exam. He marks VERY hard for a 1st yr English class and he takes forever to mark assignments. If you can, take this class with a different prof.
Incredibly boring lectures. Drones on for the whole class about basically nothing. Way too specific criteria for grading

he's a nice guy. go to his office hours if you need clarification, he'll help you out. if you want to pass make sure to ask questions to get feedback. make sure to attend class or you're not going to get those %!!

Bradley is a well-rounded prof. Gets the information across well, despite his monotoned voice. Posts a typed out version of his lectures so note-taking if fairly easy. Must go to the lectures since there is a good amount of in-class assignments.

Not a bad prof for ENG1100. This course is generally flat, but he conveyed the material effectively. He provides the essential info and does not waster your time. You often get to leave early and DGDs are too clarify info, ask questions, and do quizzes. Participation makes up a chunk of your mark. Push through with some coffee. Very kind man.

Bradley had a monotoned voice that made the lectures drag on. There were few real readings, but mostly you read grammar I never did and still could understand his lectures. There are a few assignments with clear instructions but very little feedback. I would try to find a better prof that makes the already dry material better.

Prof Bradley's class was pretty solid. Class + DGD went by smoothly, there are quizzes every other week and random in class assignments that were really easy. The essays were not very difficult to write and he gave pretty good feedback. Very accessible and flexible with essay submissions. Pretty solid guy and class. I would take it again
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Gives good feedback', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: His class is terribly boring, but making an essay writing course exciting is pretty hard to do. Sometimes he was unclear on assignment instructions, but when you speak to him one-on-one you end up receiving some helpful tips. Overall, he was a likeable guy, and it was not a stressful course.

Very easy class. Fair grader, gives good feedback. The only annoying thing was that he doesn't use slides or bright space, so you actually have to go to class; also he does do attendance at some point.

Not really much to say. Pretty average, teaches what he has to. Marking takes forever, and theres only a few thing that the mark is riding on which isn't great. I didn't have a *bad* experience, but I didn't have a great time either.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Beware of pop quizzes', 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: REALLY boring and monotone lecturer. Syllabus was generally wrong and had to re explain most assignment as every did them wrong. Does not use brightspace or slides.
Not a difficult teacher. He expects a certain level of effort. He will get mad if you do not do assigned work.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Very boring lecturer. Took me a couple classes to realize he wasn't just talking about the syllabus anymore, he was actually teaching Doesnt use brightspace or anything

ENG1100 is kind of a boring class, so I can't blame him for my almost falling asleep in class. If you have good grammar and understand that a thesis is not a question (and know how to use OWL Purdue for citations), then you'll be fine without the textbook. Some writing exercises, a paper, a couple small quizzes.
Really boring lecturer and overall mediocre professor. He is not horrible but then again he isnt amazing. Criteria for assignments and quizzes are quite clear as attendance is also mandatory.
Doesnt seem to care about his work. Doesnt keep track of students papers or grades and good luck getting a hold of him for feedback.

Super boring lectures but sometimes he'll spike my interest by talking about philosophy or various things not related to English. You don't really need to go to class, the TA posted everything online. Super easy class if you speak English well so get ready to pass with an A. Make sure to pay enough attention and write your essays.

Prof Bradley is not a bad teacher but his lectures are so boring. He doesn't use a power point or write on the board so you just listen to him talk for an hour and a half. The course is assignment heavy but none of them are overly difficult and he provides outlines for everything. The exam was open book so buy his textbook. No midterms.
Nice prof, a bit boring, but will usually end the class early. Content is dry and boring no matter which prof you have though. Study hard for the quizzes, they aren't as easy as they seem!
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Beware of pop quizzes', 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: his voice is monotone you can easily fall asleep. It seems like this is an essay writing class but we focused on non-essential elements a lot. Lots of repetition. However, if you go to his office hours, he gives good feedback. Classes should be more organized. Overall boring class and i will avoid taking his class
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Tough grader', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: Incredibly intelligent and respectable prof, but the course consisted of grammar quizzes and conceptual explanations of essay-related things, all of which were not understood by 90% of the class. Lots of repetition. Take advantage of office hours if you want to do well on the (fairly difficult) essays.

Professor Bradley's voice is indeed rather monotone, it is definitely easy to zone out during his lectures. He is late often, will end class early often, but the course itself is fairly easy and straightforward. Can't complain.

Prof. Bradley's class was extremely boring. He has a monotone voice which is not enhanced by the subject matter.  I didn't learn anything in his class, which made showing up pointless, except for the bi-weekly in-class assignments. Made us buy the new edition of the Norton Field Guide ($110), barely used. I'll avoid taking his class in the future.

Okay so, this professor is very boring, but he ends class early all the time and is always there if you need his help. I still dont know how to write an essay though, and my final is tomorrow. You learn more about strategies like Pathos, Ethos, Logos, but you do not learn how to write an essay. You have been warned. Attendence is 10% of your mark!

He's an okay prof in terms of teaching the material (although his lectures are really dry) but he doesn't email back, no matter how time-sensitive the matter is. If you want to ask him for clarification on an assignment or to review your thesis, forget it. He will not respond.  Also, he lost a few students' assignments, mine included.

Solid professor. Really interesting lectures, and gives really good feedback/ suggestions to help with your assignments. No surprises; everything is listed in the syllabus, and explained thoroughly. The course is super fun, too; keeping up with the readings & taking good notes is helpful for the exams.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Gives good feedback', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Unclear and boring. I learned more about essay writing in 30 minutes from my history prof than I did from this entire course. He was also extremely late in handing back assignments and didn't give feedback. He didn't use blackboard and I never found out what the grade for my final paper was. Still did well, no thanks to the prof.
Good guy, really easy and clear.

Prof Bradley is a very nice man, but he does not teach ENG1100 right. I was looking forward to learning about essay writing, but we did not talk about essay writing almost ever. He talked about YouTube and Twitter far too much. Overall a very boring, confusing class.  Standardized final exam was hard b/c of poor teaching throughout the semester

This class was a super easy course. He gives 3 quizzes with 10 sentences and each has an error for you to correct. Theres also a rhetorical analysis essay, research essay and the final exam. The final exam was an essay with 3 questions and then we write an essay with a choice of 3 prompts. Attend class because theres inclass assignments worth 10%
Loved his class! He is there when you need help!! Would take a class with him over Andrew Loeb any day!

Prof Bradley, likes to keep things philosophical and will have most of his essays based on philosophocal questions and debates. Going to lectures isn't mandatory but he does like his pop-quizes which consists of basic grammar.  Lectures are completly dry and personally I showed up to class really stoned all the time, and it was a breeeze.

He is quite dry and very hard to read so I didn't know what to think at first. I am a terrible writer but he is the kind of professor that notices the effort. Go to classes, pay attention, don't be afraid to ask for advice, make it clear that you're trying to succeed and you will do well, he is very reasonable.

This guy is actually a great prof- he's sarcastic and actually really funny with his dry humour. He talks a lot about his expectations and everything else, like due dates and what you'll be doing each class, is on the syllabus. My class literally had 2 essays, 3 in class quizzes and a final exam so not bad in terms of work load

impressively, entirely verbal lectures with no powerpoints or tech. it becomes a race of taking notes to catch the gist of things, so you're really forced to pay attention. one of my favorite classes out of my entire uni experience!

He's a really great lecturer, I have the attention span of a goldfish and I managed to stay entertained for 3hrs straight. He is a hard marker for sure and took a week to email me back when I had questions but the texts were interesting and he really knows what he's talking about. And I agree that there's something really charming about his dryness

Not the best but also not the worst.He is a hard marker but his TA is easier.So if u get in his class be sure u are in his TA section for DGDs cause then she will be the one that marks ur essays.This guy babbles on and on like a broken record. How to do well:DONT WRITE UR ESSAYS AT THE LAST MINUTE!Start writing 3 weeks in advance and have it edited

Bradley s clear in his lectures, and can sometimes be witty, but he was never willing to help beyond class. Go to class though because he doesn't use any sort of online material, not even powerpoints.

Prof Bradley was decent for Children's Lit. It was one of my favourite classes this semester because the material is so interesting. You definitely obtain a lot of knowledge and go in-depth into the books. That said, there was a lot of reading to do and he was a pretty picky marker for essays (2). Overall, definitely a good prof.

Professor Bradley is the definition of a "decent" prof. He was pretty monotone and didn't make the class extremely exciting for 830am, but the class content was very straight forward and it was very easy to get a good mark. He also seems like he knows what he is talking about and wants all students to do well. The final was also very easy.

Very knowledgable and a really great lecturer. He doesn't use slides or Powerpoints, but will always answer questions his students may ask. It was clear that he was very interested in what he taught, and it made the class very enjoyable.

The actual lectures don't seem very useful to go to (though the DGDs are definitely a must to attend). Professor Bradley is a decent lecturer and he is very helpful if you attend his office hours. There is something strangely charming about him, not sure what it is.

Bright guy, certainly well-read. Not the most fascinating lecturer, however. He has a way of passing on various interpretations of a novel and is quite open to alternate opinions. He is very clear on expectations as well; he prepares by asking you what questions you expect on the exam. Overall, tough grader, but a good experience nonetheless.
Boring lecturer, hard marker, knows his stuff, but seems depressed and burned out...dont take his class
Love this prof! He makes everything so interesting, and he has a very dry humour if you bother to pay attention. I'd recommend his classes to anyone.

Great prof, great lecturer. He is extremely well read. Previous to this English class I had a scarring experinece in high school, when my English teacher told me in front of the whole class that I was stupid. Bradley's class was a definite confidence booster, he tought me that your opinion does matter.

Science Fiction. Good prof. Fairly tough grader but he is always willing to discuss your grade and will justify it clearly. Certainly knows a lot about the topic and is very well-read, but definitely is not the most fascinating lecturer. Be prepared to doze off in the early morning classes. Overall, I'd recommend him though!

Decent prof - knows his stuff and has moments where he explains things that make it much clearer. HOWEVER, if you have him in the morning, get ready to FALL ASLEEP. He is the MOST soporific talker I've had to date in uni. So drink a dozen espressos before class if you want to stay awake...

I had Professor Bradley for Children's Lit and it was fantastic. His lectures were incrediably insightful and interesting. I learned a lot from this professor and really enjoyed his class. While you do have to be a decent notetaker, if you go to class and pay attention you should do fine. Nothing on the midterm was a surprise.

THE best prof I've ever had. Very insightful, doesn't try to be funny but often accidentally makes jokes (making everything 10x more interesting). Fair marker, if you see him outside of class he is also extremely helpful and gives tons of feedback. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

He's a great prof! He had awesome insight into the material and made me interested in taking more classes taught by him. Lots of teachers seem to just report the text back to you, but he made it so much mroe interesting! Awesome class-would take it again if i could
One of the worst prof's I ever had. Brutal marker even though I never missed a class. Seems to have his fav students. No way in hell i am taking another class with him. Mumble Jumble Prof.

This prof is the worst I've ever  had. He does not grade fairly and is very conservative and what he accepts in his teachings. He spent the half of one class berating everyone about their essays, and then wondered why half the class left by break. I really hate the fact that I had to take this course.
very well read, inspiring. made me want to take more courses from him.
Although he does seem nervous and it is tough to take notes in his class, if you go to class and pay attention he basically tells you what will be on the final and he marks essays fairly.

I can't deny that the charm of his nervous, introverted character has affected my opinion on his academic skills, but he really is a great professor. Notes are essential in his class. And he won't speak as if reading out of the textbook, so further work will be needed to organize and put the notes to good use.

Well, thank God I own a laptop! He teaches lecture-style, so he talks throughout the entire class and writing notes is speedy and jumbled. I have had to go over mine a few times to make sure my notes taken mad sense. He is very nice, but if you're not a strong note-taker (or advanced typist), pray that you make friends in class. ;)
boring lectures. useless comments which are impossible to read. gets off topic on babbling tangents.

Good GOD I hate English....I would love nothing more than to never read an english book again.  Anyways, with that said, Prof. Bradley was OK.  He was kinda nervous, and not too helpful and it was EXTREMELY hard to get anything out of his lecture.  Not to mention the late night class and dark lighting, I left early every time.
Professor was bland and class had nothing interesting involved.  He was, however, very accomodating, and it was his first year.

I do not like English. Prof. Bradley made it more interesting than I would have expected. His lecture style is somewhat unstructured, but I am a visual learner. If you go to class and listen you will do well. The summer class flew by quickly with him as a prof.

Knows what he's talking about. Seems very willing to help students, which is appreciated. Asks good questions for discussion and isn't afraid to bring up the sensitive topics, although for some reason it can be a little intimidating to speak up in class at times. And yeah, seems to have a certain something...
a nice guy, seems to really know his stuff. also has this certain understated charm to him...
mind numbingly boring
Nice teacher!!! okay guys only take english with him! If you just come to class you will do well!!
